intro: Mespilodaphne bahiensis, commonly known as the Bahia mume, is a species of flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers. The plant produces small, edible fruits that are similar in appearance to apples. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and unique fruit, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and for local use.
